intro: Junellia cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-colored junellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, pale green leaves that give it its distinctive ash-colored appearance. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Junellia cinerascens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
